intro: Klasea yunus-emrei, commonly known as the Yüksel Mountains bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
